title: 我继续来晒作业了~~
txt_content:
今天又有一堆作业要做...哭啊,做了好久啊...可是还有
Luke 13:18-19
New International Version (NIV)
The Parables of the Mustard Seed and the Yeast

18 Then Jesus asked, “What is the kingdom of God like? What shall I compare it to? 19 It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds perched in its branches.”

来自http://www.biblegateway.com/pass ... 3A18-19&version=NIV
要抄和背啊...圣经学校就是坑啊..好像换个啊,可是家长不样啊...


下面是我刚做的作业
TheLewis & Clark ExpeditionI.The Expedition
            A. In under threeyearsthey traveled 8000 miles from the Pacific Ocean andback.
            B. 5 main goals1. Find sourceof the missouri river
                        2. crossRockyMountains
                        3. Follow largestriver west to pacific  ocean
                        4. Establish tradewith native people
                        5. Assure nativesof the peaceful intention of the United States of America
II. Starting Out – Up the missouri
      A. 45 -personExpedition left up the Missouri River on may 14 1804
      B. Pirogues- large dugout canoes
      C. Had to endure hail, rain, allsorts of insects
      D. Met a lot of Native Americantribes, Negotiated peace between lakota and siouxtribes
III. Winter at fort mandan
      A. Built fort Mandan and hired toussaintand sacagawea as their guide and interpreter
      B. April 7, 1805 send several peoplewith plant samples and animals back to president  jefferson
IV. Heading into the Unknown
      A. April 7, 1805 33peopleleave fort Mandan into the unknown
      B. Took southforkinto the Missouri River
      C. He realized they had to cross theRocky Mountains on land with the help of horses
V. Finding the Shoshone
      A. Sacagawea recognized many landmarksandleads them into Shoshone territory
      B. Sacagawea helped make peace andwas reunited with her brother cameahwait, chief of theShoshone
      C. Bought horses from the Shoshoneand they hire a guy called “old toby”
VI. Following the Columbia River
      A. The nezperce tribe guided them
      B. Lewis saw the Pacific Ocean forthe first time
VII. Winter at fort  clatsop
      A. Expedition built Fort Clatsop andspent the winter there
      B. Wanted to find a shiptoget a ride but never found one
VII. Heading Home
      A. Left March 23, 1806, they wentback up the Columbia River and they split into two groups
      B. lewis took onegroup north, they had to ride 120 miles in oneday to escape the Blackfeet                           Indians and lewis was shot,by one of his own men, who thought he was an elk.
      C. clark went southandexplored the Yellowstone River
      D. Groups met up again at thejunction of the missouri and yellowstonw Rivers onAugust 12, 1806
IX. Home at Last
      A. Arrived in St Louis on september23 1806, they were gone 2 years 4 months and 9 days.
      B. They discovered 178 new plants, 122 new animals, and 40 Native Americantribes. 
       The Members of the Corps of Discovery
I.Meriwether Lewis
            A. Born in virginiain1774
            B. President thomasjefferson chose Lewis to be his private secretary
            C.  He learned botany (study ofplants), celestial navigation, and practical plumbing 
            D.  He chose his close military friend, WilliamClark, to join the trip with him
            E.  clark either waskilled or committed suicide along the Natchez Trace Trail
II. William Clark
            A.  He learned early on how to negotiate withNative Americans, without hatred, draw mays, and howtoearn the respect of people
            B.  He inherited a plantation and slaves; one whowent on the expedition was named York
            C.  On the journey he named a riverafterhis girlfriend, julia hancock
            D.  He became superintendent of Indian Affairs,and raised nine children
            E.  Died at the age of 68asan admired man in the nation
III.Toussaint Charbonneau
            A.  french fur trapperwholived with the hidatsa Indians
            B.  Had two wives, one was sacagawea
            C.  Difficult to get along with and not alwayscool in emergencies
IV.Sacagawea
            A. Captured by the hidatsaIndianswhen she was 12 years old from the Shoshone
            B. She had two children
            C.  She was invaluable to theexpedition
V. Jean-Baptiste
            A.  son ofSacagawea, born on February 11, 1805
            B.  He was raised by willianclark 
VI. York
            A.  Only African American on the expedition andwas a skilled hunter 
            B. Extremely strongandlarge which was the most fascinating trait to the Native Americans
            C.  He a slave, and was eventually freed by Clarkin 1811 
VII. George Drouillard
            A. He was a criticalmemberof the team
            B.  He was the best hunter andsuperior marksman in the group
            C.  He was very cool in a crisis 
XI. Seaman
            A. Lewis’ black newfoundlanddog
            B.  He was a bitten by a beaverandnearly bled to death 
X.  Sergeant CharlesFloyd
            A.  He had a burst appendix on theexpedition
            B.  He died from thisand was the only member to die on the entire expedition
XI. Mandan Tribe
            A.  The expedition spent the firstwinter here
            B.  Were eventually killed because of the smallpoxdisease 
XII. Shoshone Tribe
            A.  Sacagawea’s family was from this tribe
            B.  They traded horses so theexpedition could continue on over the Rocky Mountains
XIII. Blackfeet Tribe
            A.  A tribe that was very hostileandwar like 
            B.  Chased Lewis and he had ride 120milesin one day to escape







红色的地方是我写的...哭啊...我写了好多啊...

replies.author: MC猪人
replies.txt_content:
习近平。水手
a·刘易斯的黑色纽芬兰狗
他是一个咬伤由一个海狸andnearly流血而死亡
x中士CharlesFloyd
答:他有一个破裂附录在theexpedition
b他死从thisand是只有死在整个成员探险
习近平。曼丹人的部落
答:探险了firstwinter在这里
最终被杀害,因为smallpoxdisease
十二。休休尼人部落
萨卡加维亚的家庭从这个部落
b他们交易马所以theexpedition可以继续在落基山脉
十三。黑腿部落
答:一个非常的部落充满敌意的和战争就像
b .追逐刘易斯和他骑120年milesin一一天为了逃避
